data.title: [COACHING] How to Update Your LinkedIn Public Profile Settings | Dr. T
data.description:
Want to make the most of your LinkedIn public profile?

Join us live as we walk through the essential LinkedIn Public Profile Settings, including how to customize your profile URL and control what is visible to the public. Whether you're job searching, networking, or building your brand, visibility matters‚Äîlet‚Äôs make sure you‚Äôre putting your best digital foot forward!

What You‚Äôll Learn:

‚úÖ How to create a custom LinkedIn profile URL for easy sharing
‚úÖ What profile sections you should make public vs. private
‚úÖ How to adjust visibility settings to enhance your professional brand
‚úÖ Tips to boost credibility and discoverability on LinkedIn

Whether you're a job seeker, a professional, or a content creator, this session will help you take control of how you're seen on LinkedIn. Don‚Äôt miss it!
___

data.title: Youth and Family Summit 2025
data.description:
REGISTER HERE: https://form.jotform.com/250557454681160

The Schrader Lane Youth Task Force is proud to announce it's Youth and Family Summit 2025.

Last year's Youth Summit was so successful, we've planned this year's event to continue our community engagement and advocacy.

There will be:
- fun and games
- panel discussions
- Kid Zone
- Teen Session
- community resources
- food boxes
- engagement with first responders and law enforcement
- CE credits for child care educators
- community service hours for high schoolers and college students

Breakfast and Lunch will be served.

Registration is open until March 26, 2025.

This event is free and open to the public...so bring the ENTIRE family.

We hope to see you March 29, 2025.

#bettertogether
#onecommunity
#schraderlaneyouthtaskforcecommittee

data.title: [COHORT] FE Engineer + Career Strategy: What to expect + Prework
data.description:
Opening session for Cohort 2025-2

Welcome to Cohort 2025-2! This opening session will set you up for success by ensuring you have all the essential tools and accounts needed to fully participate.

What to Expect:

‚úÖ Overview of the Cohort Structure & Expectations
‚úÖ Access to Required Tools & Platforms
‚úÖ Step-by-Step Guide to Setting Up Your Accounts (LinkedIn, Canva, Google, ChatGPT)
‚úÖ Timeline & Key Milestones for the Next 3 Weeks

We‚Äôre giving you a couple weeks to complete your prework so that you start the program fully prepared with everything in place. By the end of this session, you‚Äôll know exactly what to do to ensure a smooth and successful learning experience.

data.title: [COHORT] Orientation
data.description:
Welcome to Repped School! üéâ This Orientation Session is designed to help you navigate our virtual space, understand how we operate, and set you up for success in the cohort.

What to Expect:

‚úÖ Tour of the Virtual School ‚Äì Learn how to access resources, discussion spaces, and support.
‚úÖ How We Communicate ‚Äì Get familiar with where to find announcements, session links, and important updates.
‚úÖ Signing Up for Sessions ‚Äì Walkthrough of how to register for upcoming live and self-paced sessions.
‚úÖ Tracking Your Progress ‚Äì Learn how to stay on top of assignments, resources, and key deadlines.
‚úÖ Where to Ask for Help ‚Äì Understand how to reach instructors, connect with peers, and get support when needed.

üí° Pro Tip: The more engaged you are, the more you‚Äôll gain from this experience. Dive in, explore, and start making connections!

data.title: Tech Vision Conference 2025
data.description:
Tech Vision 2025 is a *FREE* conference where higher education, community partners, and industry professionals exchange insights on our evolving people technology ecosystem and its impact on the workforce, organizations, and society. Connect with students, discuss workforce trends, and share innovative approaches to artificial intelligence, cybersecurity, and digital transformation to shape a better future for our region.

Seating is limited. Please register soon!

Dates:
8:00 AM-4:30 PM (Central), Thursday and Friday, April 10-11, 2025
Please let us know if you plan to attend one or both days in your selections below. 


Location: 
Miller Education Center at Middle Tennessee State University, 503 E Bell St, Murfreesboro, TN 37130
Suite 503A, 2nd Floor

Map to Building:
https://maps.app.goo.gl/WhgyHgi7CZXpxekC9

Free Parking in the Highland Lot:
https://maps.app.goo.gl/TLMwwUiYSoTWyt918
There will also be complimentary shuttles for those already on MTSU's campus. Please email Kristie.Abston@MTSU.edu for a detailed schedule.

ADA Access: 
Email Kristie.Abston@MTSU.edu with
any questions.

Event Page:
https://www.linkedin.com/events/techvision20257302187713619709954/about/
Check back for updates on the program!

Please contact Kristie Abston at Kristie.Abston@MTSU.edu if you have questions or need assistance. If your plans change, then please edit your registration or contact Kristie to cancel. 

Your email address is required below to send you a confirmation email with this information. It will only be used for conference communications.

data.title: LITTLE TABLE NASHVILLE
data.description:
‚ÄãRSVP HERE: https://lu.ma/kc4v7qmk

Join us for an evening designed to spark meaningful conversations and new connections across the Nashville tech community.

‚ÄãOur goal: to set a table for professionals from different functions to talk about cross-functional collaboration. You'll walk away with practical ideas to improve collaboration in your own work ‚Äî and form or enhance relationships with others in tech who approach problems from different angles.

‚ÄãWhether you're in product, engineering, design, marketing, data, leadership, or another tech role, this event is for you!

‚ÄãWhy You Should Attend

  • ‚ÄãNetworking with Purpose: Engage with fellow tech professionals in a relaxed but thoughtfully structured setting.
  • ‚ÄãDiverse Perspectives: Meet people from various industries, functions, and experience levels.
  • ‚ÄãTailored Discussions: Participate in small group conversations centered around real-world collaboration challenges and wins.

‚ÄãAgenda

  • ‚Äã5:30 - 6:00 PM | Drinks, light snacks, and socializing
  • ‚Äã6:00 - 6:05 PM | Welcome announcements
  • ‚Äã6:05 - 7:00 PM | Table Talk rounds
    • ‚ÄãRound 1
    • ‚ÄãRound 2
  • ‚Äã7:00 - 7:30 PM | Additional open networking

‚ÄãWant to get involved?

‚ÄãWe're looking for Table Host volunteers!
Hosts help kick off each round of conversation and keep the energy welcoming and engaging.

data.title: SQL for AI - August Repped Lab Signup Deadline
data.description:
Join the Signup List for August Repped Lab: SQL for AI

üìÖ August 4‚Äì30, 2025
üÜì Free for Repped Community members during the grant period
üìö Books and resources will be provided

USE COUPON CODE: TN-DSEW-GRANT-PERIOD

Ready to get your hands dirty with the language behind AI and automation? This Repped Lab will guide you through real-world SQL fundamentals and level you up with hands-on experience in a simulated work environment. You‚Äôll move from basic querying to multi-table joins, logic, and more‚Äîbuilding skills you can actually use. ÔªøÔªø

What We'll Work Through

  • Getting your tools and environment set up
  • Learning to ask better questions with data
  • Writing and optimizing your own SQL queries
  • Building confidence in a simulated data workflow

How It Works

Weeks 1‚Äì3: Async lab work on your own time
  • Daily office hours + SATURDAY hybrid support sessions
  • Community-first, support-on-request model
Week 4: Live evening Lab Week (in person + virtual)
  • Simulated work environment with Repped Coach support
  • Community Celebration on the final day

‚úÖ To Be Considered, You Must

  • Have a fully completed Repped profile
  • Finish Repped Orientation
  • Introduce yourself in the community
Signups will be reviewed after the deadline. You‚Äôll get a direct message if selected.ÔªøÔªø

What‚Äôs Next?

If offered a community seat, you‚Äôll receive a separate email with your Repped Prep materials‚Äîwatch your inbox and Repped Community notifications so you don‚Äôt miss out.

data.title: üéâ The REPPED LAB Grand OPENING!

Join us for the GRAND OPENING of The Repped Lab location.

Learn how to become a Repped Lab member, sign up for labs and get a lay of the land and amenities. 

See you there!

data.title: The Journey: Emerging Tech Leaders Panel
data.description:
Ready to find out what it takes to get into tech? The Journey: Emerging Tech Leaders Panel is your chance to hear straight talk from people who made it happen. Kahlil, Justin, Austin, and Trinity will break down how they got started, what threw them off, what kept them grinding, and what they wish someone had told them. Trevor and Tatiana will keep the convo flowing so you can get your questions answered live.

This is a laid-back panel where you‚Äôll get real stories from real people. Some in the audience are brand new to tech, others are switching careers, but everyone wants to know how to make their move. You‚Äôll kick it off with quick intros, then we‚Äôre going straight into Q&A. Lunch is on us if you‚Äôre in the room, and we‚Äôre streaming it so you can tune in from anywhere.

Event Details:
  • Date & Time: July 11, 2025, at 12:00 PM
  • Setup: Chill panel and open Q&A
  • Virtual: Livestream available
We want you to see what‚Äôs possible and know you‚Äôre not alone figuring this out.

data.title: Weekly Community Lunch + Office Hours
data.description:
Every Monday | 12 PM CST | Virtual in the Repped Community

Feeling stuck?
Trying to figure out your next move?
Need a tip, a tool, or just a space to say your idea out loud?

Come through for our weekly Repped Lunch + Office Hours.
Bring your questions, your blockers, your ‚Äúis this even a good idea?‚Äù moments. Whether you're building your tech skills, your brand, or your community‚Äîthis space is for you.

Here‚Äôs what to expect:

  • A small, supportive group of other Repped folks just like you
  • Everyone gets a chance to ask a question or share what they‚Äôre working through
  • Want feedback? Share your screen. Want a vibe check? We got you.
  • Come for the whole hour or just pop in and out. No pressure.
We're not recording. This is live, real-time support, every week.

‚úçÔ∏è Got a question already? Drop it in the comments below so we can make space for it.
See you Monday. Bring your lunch or just bring yourself.

data.title: Monthly Repped Interest Session
data.description:
12 PM CST | Virtual in the Repped Community

Curious about joining a Repped Sprint, Workshop, or Event ‚Äî but not sure where to start?

Our Monthly Interest Session is your chance to learn what Repped is all about. In just 30 minutes with 15 minutes open to questions, we‚Äôll walk you through what‚Äôs coming up, how to get involved, and how each experience helps you grow your reputation, influence, and tech skills.

Whether you're exploring your options or ready to dive in, this session is a no-pressure space to ask questions, get answers, and meet the community.

We host it once a month. Show up curious ‚Äî leave with a plan.

‚úçÔ∏è Got a question already? Drop it in the comments below so we can make space for it.

data.title: Land Your First Tech Job: 5 Things We Wish We Knew
data.description:
Everyone repeats the same playbook. Apply online. Cross your fingers. Wait. If you really want to get that first role finished and start building momentum, there are more paths than most people consider. Some do not start at six figures, but they can put you in position to earn more over the long run. In this session, we will cover the five things we wish we knew before our first offers, how those lessons translate to today‚Äôs job market, and how to use AI thoughtfully to speed up the work that gets you hired.

What you will learn

  1. Portfolio first, resume second
  2. Seek outcomes, not titles
  3. Small markets, short cycles
  4. Proof beats perfection
  5. Relationships compound

data.title: Sprint Kick-off #1 [LIVE RESTREAM]
data.description:
This sprint, we are focusing on a Javascript, HTML & CSS project that will be a fun starter project before we start looking at various other topics.

‚úÖ JOIN US:
Repped Sprints start the 3rd Monday of every month and you can join by visiting https://reppedin.tech and becoming a Blueprint Member. üí∞   [GRANT FUNDED UNTIL JULY 2026!]

data.title: [IN PERSON] Sprint Workgroup #1
data.description:
A weekly, hybrid coworking session where you power through a common project on your own, side by side, and help each other when stuck. Quiet focus. Quick unblocks. Small wins you can show.

Core skill you gain

Independent execution with peer unblocking.
You learn to make steady progress on your own while using the room to get unstuck fast and keep momentum.
What that looks like in practice:
  • Set a tiny target, do the work, show the receipt
  • Ask focused questions that get real answers
  • Offer quick tips that unblock a peer
  • Track progress simply and honestly

data.title: Sprint #1 - WorkGroup - Typing Test
data.description:
Join the Blueprint Crew for a working session. This is the last workgroup of the sprint, so come prepared to show us what you built and what you are most proud of.

If you want to join Blueprint, get started.

data.title: Coffee While Autistic with Dr. Vas - Boundaries FIRST
data.description: Access is earned. In this episode, Dr. T lays out a boundaries-first approach for every part of life: family, friendships, community spaces, services, and work. You will learn a clear Gate model for deciding who gets access, a quick stress test for behavior under pressure, and scripts to move asks to written, pivot to paid, or exit without drama. Leave with one boundary you will enforce before your next yes and a plan to practice it this week.

data.title: Coffee While Autistic with Dr. Vas
data.description: Join Dr. Vas for a quick coffee chat on a topic that impacts the Neurodiverse community,

data.title: Sprint Kick-off #2 [LIVE STREAM]
data.description:
This sprint, we are focusing on a learning path that movs us from JS fundamentals into Object-Oriented Programming (OOP) and data structures (how data is saved so we can access it to use in our applications), then build a playable Tetris in modern JavaScript.

During this kick-off, we're helping you set aside take this time to Fill out your Accountability Sheet, get started on the learning path, or ask any question you have via the live chat!

‚úÖ JOIN US:
Repped Sprints typically start the 3rd Monday of every month and you can join by visiting https://reppedin.tech and becoming a Blueprint Member. üí∞   [GRANT FUNDED UNTIL JULY 2026!]

data.title: Body Doubling | VIRTUAL
data.description: This is a quiet, low-pressure virtual room for body doubling. Bring one task you want to work on and use the shared presence to help you get started and stay with it. Microphones are off. Cameras can be on or off‚Äîyour choice. Chat is open if you want to check in, ask a quick question, or share what you‚Äôre working on. data.title: Body Doubling | IN PERSON
data.description: This is an in-person body doubling session for focused, parallel work. Bring a task you‚Äôve been putting off or want to make progress on and work quietly alongside others in the same space.
